001package org.hd.d.TRVmodel.hg;
002
003/**Simple static extensions to the recreation of the heat-pump / TRV / energy interactions from Heat Geek's page:
004 * <a href="https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/">https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/</a>
005 * as of ~2023-06.
006 */
007public final class HGTRVHPMModelExtensions
008        {
009        /**Prevent creation of an instance. */
010    private HGTRVHPMModelExtensions() { }
011
012        /**Extras available extrapolating from the HG description. */
013        /**AFA: approximate floor and ceiling area per room A). */
014        public static final double PER_A_FLOOR_AREA_M2 =
015                HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_LENGTH_M * HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_LENGTH_M;
016
017    /**TFA: approximate total floor area ignoring wall thickness (m^2). */
018    public static final double HOME_TOTAL_FLOOR_AREA_M2 =
019                HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.PER_A_FLOOR_AREA_M2 * 4;
020    /**TERA approximate total roof area ignoring wall thickness (m^2). */
021    public static final double HOME_TOTAL_ROOF_AREA_M2 =
022                HOME_TOTAL_FLOOR_AREA_M2;
023    /**TEWL: approximate external wall length (ignoring wall thickness (m). */
024    public static final double HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_LENGTH_M =
025                HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_LENGTH_M * 8;
026    /**TEWA: approximate external wall area (ignoring wall thickness, windows, doors (m2). */
027    public static final double HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_AREA_M2 =
028                HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_LENGTH_M * HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_HEIGHT_M;
029    /**EWU: effective total external wall U value if only source of heat loss to outside (W/m^2K).
030     * This figure is assuming no heat loss through any other route, eg floor or roof,
031     * or ventilation losses, or indeed occupancy and appliance gains.
032     */
033    public static final double HOME_LOSSLESS_FLOOR_AND_ROOF_EXTERNAL_WALL_U_WpM2K =
034                HGTRVHPMModel.HOME_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK / HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_AREA_M2;
035    /**EWRU: effective total external wall and roof U value if only sources of heat loss to outside (W/m^2K).
036     * This figure is assuming no heat loss through any other route, eg floor,
037     * or ventilation losses, or indeed occupancy and appliance gains.
038     * <p>
039     * This assumes roof and external wall roof U values are the same
040     * (usually roof is a little lower in reality).
041     * <p>
042     * English 1970 regs U values for external walls and roof:
043     * <ul>
044     * <li>1970: 1.6, 1.5</li>
045     * <li>1980: 1.0, 0.68</li>
046     * <li>1990: 0.60, 0.40</li>
047     * </ul>
048     * <p>
049     * See: https://www.ecomerchant.co.uk/news/a-brief-history-of-building-regulation-u-values-with-examples/
050     * <p>
051     * Implied value of 0.61 is ~1980s.
052     */
053    public static final double HOME_LOSSLESS_FLOOR_EXTERNAL_WALL_AND_ROOF_U_WpM2K =
054        HGTRVHPMModel.HOME_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK / (HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_AREA_M2 + HOME_TOTAL_ROOF_AREA_M2);
055    /**IFU: internal floor U value (W/m^2K).
056     * Wall U-value used for internal floor U value for simplicity, eg given
057     * plasterboard then 8 inch joist space then tongue-and-groove boards ~1.4/1.7.
058     * <p>
059     * Treated as symmetric for simplicity.
060     * <p>
061     * See: https://www.diydata.com/information/u_values/u_values.php
062     */
063    public static final double INTERNAL_FLOOR_U_WpM2K =
064                HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_U_WpM2K;
065        }
